title: GERRyanD
author: GERRyanD
created_time: March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMLast edit: March 18, 2023, 02:21:53 PM by GERRyanD
content: Hello. I offer advertisements on ico-calendar.com.Our "ICO of the week" usually makes a profit of 1000 - 2000 % in the advertising period. The site has 1500 visitors a day. Each ICO investor pays an average of 20,000 $. This means that if 1 % of the website visitors in the advertising period invests in the "ICO of the week", you get 2.100.000 $ from the investors plus the 1000 - 2000 % price increase.The top banner for the "Ico of the Week" costs € 5000 for the 7 days. If the advertising campaign flops, the money will be returned.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMAdvertising for my site is probably prohibited here. Let me guess. Pornography?

comments.author: GERRyanD
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on March 17, 2023, 06:11:47 PMQuote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMAdvertising for my site is probably prohibited here. Let me guess. Pornography?Can you read? It's an ICO portal, not a porno site.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:17:44 PMCan you read? It's an ICO portal, not a porno site.I read, there are no restrictions for ICO/IDO type of things unless it's NSFW that's what I meant.

comments.author: nioctib_100
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMAdvertising for my site is probably prohibited here. If you are interested, please write PN.You are free to share the site name in a normal discussion, I wouldn't consider that advertising at all. Tons of people post their projects here to get feedback and discussion. The catch is that you'll have to be open to criticism on the project as well. When we can all talk freely about your project, then it's a discussion and not just an advertisement. So what's the site?

comments.author: redsun114
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMHello. I offer advertisements on ico-calendar.com.Our "ICO of the week" usually makes a profit of 1000 - 2000 % in the advertising period. The site has 1500 visitors a day. Each ICO investor pays an average of 20,000 $. This means that if 1 % of the website visitors in the advertising period invests in the "ICO of the week", you get 2.100.000 $ from the investors plus the 1000 - 2000 % price increase.The top banner for the "Ico of the Week" costs € 5000 for the 7 days. If the advertising campaign flops, the money will be returned.Quote from: GERRyanD on March 18, 2023, 10:22:22 AMico-calendar.comAdvertising for your site isn't prohibited here unless it has unethical things and/or is involved in things that have to do with legal aspects. Otherwise, you are free to advertise your services and for that, you will need to move your topic to the Service Announcements section and edit your post and add proper information that users might require.If you don't know how to move a topic, please scroll down to the bottom of this page, and look at the bottom-left side. You will find two options, one is to lock the topic and the other one is to move the topic, click on the second option that says move topic. On the next screen, select the desired section and click the button below.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMThe site has 1500 visitors a day. can you explain such a large number of daily visits for a site that is only 6 days old? I mean, the domain is registered on 13.03.2023.Code:Domain name: ico-calendar.comRegistry Domain ID: 2764815602_DOMAIN_COM-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.namecheap.comRegistrar URL: http://www.namecheap.comUpdated Date: 0001-01-01T00:00:00.00ZCreation Date: 2023-03-13T17:04:56.00ZRegistrar Registration Expiration Date: 2024-03-13T17:04:56.00ZQuote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMEach ICO investor pays an average of 20,000 $. This means that if 1 % of the website visitors in the advertising period invests in the "ICO of the week", you get 2.100.000 $ from the investors plus the 1000 - 2000 % price increase.Who says that? do you have any official data for this claim?because of such an opinion that you are trying to express, we have a bunch of fraudsters who are trying to deceive investors with fake ICO projects, which only cause damage to the crypto world. the best evidence is the many "GPT" ICOs that try to abuse the current trend of the gpt keyword.Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMThe top banner for the "Ico of the Week" costs € 5000 for the 7 days. If the advertising campaign flops, the money will be returned.what guarantee do you give that you will return the money? Will you agree to use escrow even in the event that the advertising campaign fails and does not raise $2+ million to guarantee the return of the money?

comments.author: TheGreatPython
comments.body: Quote from: GERRyanD on March 18, 2023, 10:22:22 AMico-calendar.comI have a question and a concern about the service you are providing. You said that the banner space costs 5,000 euros per week and the website gets about 1,500 visitors per day, etc. Do you have any screenshots or something to prove that what you said is actually true? The rate you are asking for just a banner space is too much in my opinion.One can easily get a lot of better ad spaces if one simply uses Google ads. What's so special about your website? Your rates are too high compared to other legit and genuine advertising services.

comments.author: GERRyanD
comments.created_time: March 22, 2023, 10:27:48 AMLast edit: March 22, 2023, 10:40:51 AM by GERRyanD
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on March 19, 2023, 12:18:00 AMcan you explain such a large number of daily visits for a site that is only 6 days old? I mean, the domain is registered on 13.03.2023.Quote from: GERRyanD on March 17, 2023, 06:09:42 PMEach ICO investor pays an average of 20,000 $. This means that if 1 % of the website visitors in the advertising period invests in the "ICO of the week", you get 2.100.000 $ from the investors plus the 1000 - 2000 % price increase.Who says that? do you have any official data for this claim?because of such an opinion that you are trying to express, we have a bunch of fraudsters who are trying to deceive investors with fake ICO projects, which only cause damage to the crypto world. the best evidence is the many "GPT" ICOs that try to abuse the current trend of the gpt keyword.As you can see in the other Treaths, I have been operating different ICO portals for a long time. I have now forwarded all domains to this. In addition, advertising measures.You will have to operate Google yourself. Then you know the average.Why should I cheat someone if I can simply publish the advertising? It's not that I could book ten at the same time. A good reputation brings much more.Quote from: TheGreatPython on March 19, 2023, 06:40:50 PMI have a question and a concern about the service you are providing. You said that the banner space costs 5,000 euros per week and the website gets about 1,500 visitors per day, etc. Do you have any screenshots or something to prove that what you said is actually true? The rate you are asking for just a banner space is too much in my opinion.One can easily get a lot of better ad spaces if one simply uses Google ads. What's so special about your website? Your rates are too high compared to other legit and genuine advertising services.No, these are completely unrealistic assumption that show me that you have so far neither marketed an ICO nor have been able to switch any crypto advertising at all. First, Google does not accept such advertising. Second, you cannot simply calculate a normal Google Ads price of $ 0.20 to the clicks and compare with normal advertising for an online shop. As an ICO operator, I sometimes get bids over 15K for such an advertising. Larger portals much more. And it's worth it for both.
